title: Trainer Saeed bin Suroor to make late call on running Benbatl in the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes
text:
Trainer Saeed bin Suroor will make a late decision on whether Benbatl runs in Saturday’s Qipco Queen Elizabeth II Stakes as heavy ground at Ascot threatens to affect British Champions Day.

The mount of Oisin Murphy, impressive when winning at Newmarket last month and winner of Group One races in Australia, Dubai and Germany, is chasing his first top-level success on British soil.

But the only time he encountered heavy ground — at Haydock in 2017 — he disappointed.

Benbatl (above) is seeking to follow up Group One victories in Australia, Dubai and Germany

Bin Suroor said: ‘We will declare the horse and it is the plan to run, but we will check to see if the ground is suitable. I will walk the course and be able to talk to the jockeys who ride in the earlier races. Benbatl worked well on Saturday and is in good form.

‘Good to soft ground would be good for him but I don’t think he will like heavy.’

The Revenant, proven on heavy ground, is now 5-2 favourite for the QEII with Benbatl out to 11-2.
description: Trainer Saeed bin Suroor will make a late decision on whether Benbatl runs in Saturday's Qipco Queen Elizabeth II Stakes as heavy ground at Ascot threatens to affect British Champions Day.
authors: Marcus Townend For The Daily Mail
